qas.question: What is a key component of control and preventing asthma attacks?
What are some of the more common triggers?

answers.text: allergens, smoke (tobacco and other), air pollution, non selective beta-blockers, and sulfite-containing foods

qas.question: What can reduce the effectiveness of medications?
What did law that limit smoking accomplish?

answers.text: decrease the number of people hospitalized for asthma

qas.question: What type of exercise can provide small improvements?
What is a main way people can prevent reactions to dust mites?

plausible_answers.text: non selective beta-blockers, and sulfite-containing foods

qas.question: The two most common things used with corticosteroids?
What do sulfite-containing foods reduce the effectiveness of?
What decreases the number of people who are hospitalized for passive smoke exposure?

plausible_answers.text: Dust mite control measures, including air filtration, chemicals to kill mites, vacuuming, mattress covers and others methods

qas.question: What methods have no effect on smokers quality of life?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Avoidance of triggers<b5_0/><a0_0/> is a key component of improving control and preventing attacks. The most common triggers include <a1_0>allergens, smoke (tobacco and other), air pollution, <b6_0>non selective beta-blockers, and sulfite-containing foods<b6_0/><a1_0/>. <a2_0>Cigarette smoking and second-hand smoke<a2_0/> (passive smoke) may reduce the effectiveness of <b7_0>medications such as corticosteroids<b7_0/>. <b8_0>Laws that limit smoking<b8_0/> <a3_0>decrease the number of people hospitalized for asthma<a3_0/>. <b9_0>Dust mite control measures, including air filtration, chemicals to kill mites, vacuuming, mattress covers and others methods<b9_0/> had no effect on asthma symptoms. Overall, exercise is beneficial in people with stable asthma. <a4_0>Yoga<a4_0/> could provide small improvements in quality of life and symptoms in people with asthma.
